byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED and EVELYN M. RUSLI

abstract: Broken up, the pieces of Yahoo might be worth more than the search-engine company as a whole.
snippet: Broken up, the pieces of Yahoo might be worth more than the search-engine company as a whole.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of the Chinese Internet company Alibaba, Jack Ma, has breathed new life into the potential bidding for Yahoo, telling a Stanford University audience that he was "very interested" in the company.

headline.main: Questions Over Yahoo's Value as Buyers Weigh Bids
